title: How to Make Nannari Sherbet Concentrate

steps.headline: Break the sarsaparilla roots into 1 to 2 inch (2.5 to 5.1 cm) pieces.
Dry them very well in the hot sun.
Lightly crush and remove the hard portion from the inside.
Powder the roots in a dry grinder.
Boil water and remove the water from the heat.
steps.description: Add the root powder and mix well.

steps.headline: Leave on the side for 8 to 10 hours, undisturbed.
Strain using fine muslin cloth and add sugar to it.
Place it on the stove again and stir continuously to prevent the sugar sticking on the bottom.
steps.description: Make sure it gets into a slightly, sticky consistency.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat and cool well.
steps.description: Add juice from the lemons. Lime juice is optional, as the juice preserves it very well.

text: Break the sarsaparilla roots into 1 to 2 inch (2.5 to 5.1 cm) pieces.  Dry them very well in the hot sun.  Lightly crush and remove the hard portion from the inside.  Powder the roots in a dry grinder.  Boil water and remove the water from the heat. Add the root powder and mix well. Leave on the side for 8 to 10 hours, undisturbed.  Strain using fine muslin cloth and add sugar to it.  Place it on the stove again and stir continuously to prevent the sugar sticking on the bottom. Make sure it gets into a slightly, sticky consistency. Remove from the heat and cool well. Add juice from the lemons. Lime juice is optional, as the juice preserves it very well. Finished.
